data: PED OMFS Cleft Alveolar Bone Graft Repair - Post Operative (Multiphase)
Nurse to Initiate Surgeon Immediate Post Operative phase. These orders continue on the Inpatient Unit
Discontinue PED ANES Pre-Operative (Day of Surgery) PowerPlan
While patient is in Anesthetic Care Unit, assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards, once patient has been admitted to inpatient unit, please follow
PRN, Ice Pack Application, for 36 hours, ice to donor site iliac crest. Ideally 30 minutes on 30 minutes off. Patient can change pack when able
PRN, Ice Pack Application, for 36 hours, ice to jaws bilaterally. Ideally 30 minutes on 30 minutes off. Patient can change pack when able
No straws, popsicle sticks. Do not suction intraorally. No blowing nose
While patient is in Anesthetic Care Unit, assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards, once patient has been admitted to inpatient unit, please follow
Site: Iliac Crest, Reinforce PRN, While patient is in Anesthetic Care Unit, assess as per Anesthetic Care Unit Assessment Standards, once patient has been admitted to inpatient unit, please follow
1 application, topical, as directed, PRN other (see comment),
With sippy cup and/or open cup
1 spray, nasal-both, q2h, PRN congestion, drug form: nose spray
1 spray, nasal-both, BID, PRN congestion, drug form: nose spray
0.2 mg/kg, IV, q8h, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
30 mg/kg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, consider clindamycin
10 mg/kg, IV, q8h, order duration: 7 day, drug form: inj
4 drop, ear-both, BID, order duration: 5 day, drug form: ear drop
Inpatient Nurse to initiate the Surgeon Post Operative (Floor) phase of this plan
q1h for 4 hours, then q2h for 4 hours then q4h
T;N, May remove post-op day 1 in AM before 0700
15 mL, swish and spit, QID after food and bedtime
T;N, QID after food and bedtime, Rinse mouth with water after eating
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
T;N, Other Diet (please specify), Only cool liquids
Ensure Plus Calories, Breakfast|Lunch|Dinner, 120 mL, Quantity: 2
Other Supplement (please specify), Breakfast | Dinner | Lunch, 120 mL, 2
Calculate Pediatric Maintenance Fluids based on 4-2-1 Rule
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)

For pain management orders, including antiemetics and antipruritics, use either the PED SURG Post Op Pain and Symptom Management for Age Greater than or Equal to 6 Months (Multiphase) OR the PED SURG Post Op Pain and Symptom Management for Age Less than 6 Months (Multiphase) PowerPlan
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 94% or greater
Family Care Conference or Meeting Needed
End of Life, Code Blue, Death
Discharge Planning or Coordinate of Care
